chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
s: seq R
i: nat

Goal:
sorted Rle s -> (i < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, nth x0 s i <= last x0 s

Premises:
Rle = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 < r2 \/ r1 = r2 : R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
last = fun T : Type => fix last (x : T) (s : seq T) {struct s} : T := match s with | [::] => x | x' :: s' => last x' s' end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
Notation seq := list
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope nat_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
sorted = fix sorted (T : Type) (Ord : T -> T -> Prop) (s : seq T) {struct s} : Prop := match s with | [::] => True | [:: h0] => True | h0 :: (h1 :: _) as t0 => Ord h0 h1 /\ sorted T Ord t0 end : forall T : Type, (T -> T -> Prop) -> seq T -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0%nat | _ :: s' => S (size s') end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
sorted_head : forall (s : seq R) (i : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, head x0 s <= nth x0 s i
sorted_incr : forall (s : seq R) (i j : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i <= j)%nat -> (j < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, nth x0 s i <= nth x0 s j
nth_last : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s (Init.Nat.pred (size s)) = last x0 s
sorted_nth : forall (Ord : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s0 : seq ?T), sorted Ord s0 < -> (forall i0 : nat, (i0 < Init.Nat.pred (size s0))%nat -> forall x0 : ?T, Ord (nth x0 s0 i0) (nth x0 s0 (S i0))) where ?T : [s : seq R i : nat |- Type]
sorted_cat : forall (Ord : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s1 s2 : seq ?T) (x0 : ?T), sorted Ord s1 -> sorted Ord s2 -> Ord (last x0 s1) (head x0 s2) -> sorted Ord (s1 ++ s2) where ?T : [s : seq R i : nat |- Type]
nth_uniq : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x0 : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)) (i j : nat), ssrnat.leq (S i) (size s) -> ssrnat.leq (S j) (size s) -> uniq s -> eqtype.eq_op (nth x0 s i) (nth x0 s j) = eqtype.eq_op i j
nth0 : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s 0 = head x0 s
nth_default : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (n : nat), ssrnat.leq (size s) n -> nth x0 s n = x0
interval_finite_subdiv : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal), a <= b -> {l : seq R | head 0 l = a /\ last 0 l = b /\ (forall i : nat, (S i < size l)%nat -> nth 0 l i < nth 0 l (S i) <= nth 0 l i + eps)}
head_rev : forall (x0 : ?T) (l : seq ?T), head x0 (rev l) = last x0 l where ?T : [s : seq R i : nat |- Type]
last_rev : forall (x0 : ?T) (l : seq ?T), last x0 (rev l) = head x0 l where ?T : [s : seq R i : nat |- Type]
nth_zip : forall (S T : Type) (x : S) (y : T) (s : seq S) (t : seq T) (i : nat), size s = size t -> nth (x, y) (zip s t) i = (nth x s i, nth y t i)
nth_rev : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x0 (rev s) n = nth x0 s (ssrnat.subn (size s) (S n))
last_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 x : T) (s : seq T), last x s = nth x0 (x :: s) (size s)
interval_finite_subdiv_between : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal) (Hab : a <= b), let l := proj1_sig (interval_finite_subdiv a b eps Hab) in forall i : nat, (i < size l)%nat -> a <= nth 0 l i <= b
mem_nth : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x0 : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)) (n : nat), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x0 s n \in s
nth_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (f : nat -> T) (n i : nat), ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth x0 (mkseq f n) i = f i
nth_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (x : T) (n : nat), nth x0 (rcons s x) n = (if ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) then nth x0 s n else if eqtype.eq_op n (size s) then x else x0)
nth_cat : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s1 s2 : seq T) (n : nat), nth x0 (s1 ++ s2) n = (if ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s1) then nth x0 s1 n else nth x0 s2 (ssrnat.subn n (size s1)))
last_unzip1 : forall (x0 : ?S) (y0 : ?T) (s0 : seq (?S * ?T)), last x0 (unzip1 s0) = fst (last (x0, y0) s0) where ?S : [s : seq R i : nat |- Type] ?T : [s : seq R i : nat |- Type]
size_compat : forall s : seq R, Rlength (seq2Rlist s) = size s
take_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> take (S n) s = rcons (take n s) (nth x0 s n)
BinIntDef.Z.opp = fun x : Z => match x with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos x0 => Z.neg x0 | Z.neg x0 => Z.pos x0 end : Z -> Z Argument scope is [Z_scope]
nthK : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x0 : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), uniq s -> {in ssrnat.gtn (size s), ssrfun.cancel (nth x0 s) (fun x : eqtype.Equality.sort T => index x s)}
head_rcons : forall (x0 : ?T) (s0 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), head x0 (rcons s0 t) = head t s0 where ?T : [s : seq R i : nat |- Type]

```coq
intros s i Hs Hi x0.
assert (H: nth x0 s i <= last x0 s).
{
  apply sorted_head with (i:=i) in Hs; auto.
  rewrite nth_last; auto.
}
exact H.
Qed.```

original: intros s i Hs Hi x0. assert (H: nth x0 s i <= last x0 s). { apply sorted_head with (i:=i) in Hs; auto. rewrite nth_last; auto. } apply H.
